column4: hey guys, anyone here by any chance installed ubuntu 8.10 on VMWARE workstation?
the desktop doesnt start up and it gives me permission denied when i try to "startx"
'sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start' if you're running gnome (regular ubuntu)
it is, ill test that out
you have to make sure, though, that there isn't already an X server running, or gdm.
how can i make sure of that?
also, sometimes a restart works, or a stop/start
restart didnt work
ah, use the command 'ps -AF | grep X'
it will return 'grep X', you can ignore that, you're looking for something like '/usr/bin/X'
then, do the same thing w/gdm, i.e. 'ps -AF | grep gdm'
ok
if either show up, make sure to kill them using the process number in the first column from the ps command output
i.e. 'kill <process #>
thanks will do
and if that won't kill it: 'kill -9 <process #>'
have you *ever* gotten X to start correctly?
no, its still the first install in vmware and it didnt X didnt work at all
ah, you may need to check your x log, /var/log/Xorg.0.log
it says /etc/X11/Xsession: 75: cannot create /dev/null: permission denied .. then it shots down
you got that when you ran 'sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start'?
no i get GNOME has started when i run that command, then i get what i showed you when i try to startx
i've never had luck w/startx, i've *always* used /etc/init.d/gdm
